===Etymology===
Borrowed from a language in the {{w|Western Regions}} during the {{w|Han Dynasty}}. Compare {{cog|fa|بربط‎‎|tr=barbat||[[barbat]]; lute}}, {{cog|grc|βάρβιτος||[[barbitos]]; ancient stringed instrument}}.

Both characters were initially non-[[checked]] tone characters. Reborrowed during the {{w|Tang Dynasty}} from a source that more closely resembles the modern Persian name of the instrument, and both characters were read as if they have checked codas. The original non-checked readings were restored after the Tang Dynasty. Compare the modern checked-tone dialectal readings of {{zh-l|枇杷}}.

Much folk etymology exists surrounding the name origin. The dictionary ''{{w|Shiming}}'' {{defdate|2nd CE}} explains the name as {{zh-l|批把|slap-grasp}}, reflecting the plucking movements while playing the stringed instrument. {{lang|zh|琵琶}} is also cognate with—and possibly gave rise to the name of (due to the similarity in shape)—{{zh-l|枇杷|[[loquat]]}}, which is also a non-native species.
